intro: Lecythis gracilipes, commonly known as the slender lecythium, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The tree produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are followed by woody, spiny fruits containing a single large seed. The bark and fruit of Lecythis gracilipes have been used traditionally for their medicinal properties. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
